Package controller

Class ChessController

java.lang.Object
controller.ChessController
public class ChessController extends Object
This class is the controller for the MVC setup. This class will facilitate the communication between the view (ChessGUIView) and the model (ChessModel). Note that the view is NOT called in this class. Rather, as the users interact with the GUI, calls will be made from the GUI to the controller and then to the model.

  • Constructor Details

    • ChessController

      public ChessController​(ChessModel model)
      This constructor will be called by the view (ChessGUIView). The controller (and model) will be initialized in the view.
      Parameters:
      model - the model (ChessModel) that handles game logic

  • Method Details

    • isMyTurn

      public boolean isMyTurn()
      This method will be called by the view (ChessGUIView) to ensure that it is the turn of the player (white/black) who is clicking on the game board. This is to prevent unwanted / accidental clicks from changing the status of the game. The boolean (isWhite) will be sent from the view to the controller. The return value is another boolean that indicates if the model has approved the move attempted by the player clicking on the board. True if it is the turn of the player that clicked on the board, else false.
      Returns:
      a boolean indicating it is or is NOT the player's turn to move

    • setWhiteTurn

      public void setWhiteTurn​(boolean turn)
      This method will set the whiteTurn boolean value in the model to the boolean that is passed as a parameter.
      Parameters:
      turn - a boolean to indicate if it is the white player's turn

    • isWhiteTurn

      public boolean isWhiteTurn()
      This is a getter for the status of the white player's turn.
      Returns:
      a boolean indicating if it is the white player's turn

    • legalFirstClick

      public boolean legalFirstClick​(ChessGUIView.compoundKey coordinates)
      The players interact with the GUI game board by first clicking on the piece they want to move, then clicking on the block the wish to move the piece to. The method will determine if the first click made by the player is valid. For example, if the white player clicks on a white pawn, the model will confirm that the move is valid (true). But, if the white player attempts to move a black pawn, then the model will declare the move invalid (false). This method will be called from the view, which sends the coordinates of the block where the player clicked. The coordinates are stored as a compoundKey (see ChessGUIView). The model will check the coordinates to ensure the player is moving a game piece legally.
      Parameters:
      coordinates - a compoundKey storing the coordinates where the player clicked
      Returns:
      a boolean, true if click is legal, else false

    • makeMove

      public boolean makeMove​(ChessGUIView.compoundKey firstClickCoords, ChessGUIView.compoundKey secondClickCoords)
      This method is the second step in the process of verifying a legal move. The method will be called by the view which will send the coordinates of the piece the player wants to move and the coordinates of the block that the player wishes to move the piece to. The coordinates will be sent to the model which will return a boolean indicating if the move is legal (true) or not (false).
      Parameters:
      firstClickCoords - a compoundKey storing the coordinates where the player first clicked
      secondClickCoords - a compoundKey storing the coordinates where the player clicked second
      Returns:
      a boolean, true if click is legal, else false

    • legalSecondMove

      public boolean legalSecondMove​(ChessGUIView.compoundKey firstClickCoords, ChessGUIView.compoundKey secondClickCoords)
      This method is similar to legalFirstClick. It will send the coordinates of the first and second clicks to the model to verify they are valid moves.
      Parameters:
      firstClickCoords - a compoundKey storing the coordinates where the player first clicked
      secondClickCoords - a compoundKey storing the coordinates where the player clicked second
      Returns:
      a boolean, true if click is legal, else false

    • getPieceString

      public String getPieceString​(int i, int j)
      This method will aid in the construction of the game board. The view will call this method as it constructs the board. The view will send the coordinates of each block on the game board. This method will send those coordinates to the model which will return a string the represents a game piece (pawn, king, queen, etc.). Note that these strings are what create the visual pieces on the board.
      Parameters:
      i - an integer representing the x coordinate
      j - an integer representing the y coordinate
      Returns:
      a String representing a game piece

    • loadGame

      public void loadGame​(File gameFile, boolean isWhite)
      This method will enable users to load a previous game. The method will be called by the view which will send a File containing information about saved game they wish to continue. From here, the model will be sent the file and set up the game as per the File.
      Parameters:
      gameFile - a File with info to load a previously saved game

    • saveGame

      public String saveGame()
      This method will enable users to save a game that can later be re-loaded and played.
      Returns:
      a String containing info about the saved game

    • getValidMoveSet

      public Set<ChessGUIView.compoundKey> getValidMoveSet​(ChessGUIView.compoundKey firstClick)
      This method will be called from the view which sends the coordinates of the player's first clicked block. From here, the model will receive the coordinates and return them as a Set.
      Parameters:
      firstClick - a compoundKey storing the coordinates where the player first clicked
      Returns:
      a Set of compoundKeys with coordinates

    • startServer

      public void startServer()
      This method will start the server so the users can play on a network.

    • startClient

      public void startClient()
      This method will start the client so the users can play on a network.

    • networked

      public boolean networked()
      A getter to check if the game is networked.
      Returns:
      a boolean, ture if networked, else false
